intro: Valerianella triceras, commonly known as three-lobed valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in meadows and woodland areas. Valerianella triceras is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
